info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 29 at 8:35PM CDT by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Iowa...
Iowa River near Lone Tree affecting Washington, Johnson and Louisa Counties.
Iowa River at Oakville affecting Louisa County.
...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Iowa...
Iowa River at Wapello affecting Louisa County.
* WHAT...Flooding is possible.
* WHERE...Iowa River at Oakville.
* WHEN...From late Thursday night until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural land is ongoing. Several county roads are under water and closed.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet.
info.instruction:
If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding.
Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
The next statement will be issued by Wednesday evening at 845 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
